trans-unit.target: dotnet-run

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: dotnet-run
trans-unit.target: dotnet-run

trans-unit.source: NAME
trans-unit.target: NAME

trans-unit.source: dotnet-run -- Runs source code 'in-place' without any explicit compile or launch commands.
trans-unit.target: dotnet-run -- Runs source code 'in-place' without any explicit compile or launch commands.

trans-unit.source: SYNOPSIS
trans-unit.target: SYNOPSIS

trans-unit.source: DESCRIPTION
trans-unit.target: DESCRIPTION

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet run` command provides a convenient option to run your application from the source code with one command.
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet run` command provides a convenient option to run your application from the source code with one command.

trans-unit.source: It compiles source code, generates an output program and then runs that program.
trans-unit.target: It compiles source code, generates an output program and then runs that program.

trans-unit.source: This command is useful for fast iterative development and can also be used to run a source-distributed program (for example, a website).
trans-unit.target: This command is useful for fast iterative development and can also be used to run a source-distributed program (for example, a website).

trans-unit.source: This command relies on [`dotnet build`](dotnet-build.md) to build source inputs to a .NET assembly, before launching the program.
trans-unit.target: This command relies on [`dotnet build`](dotnet-build.md) to build source inputs to a .NET assembly, before launching the program.

trans-unit.source: The requirements for this command and the handling of source inputs are all inherited from the build command.
trans-unit.target: The requirements for this command and the handling of source inputs are all inherited from the build command.

trans-unit.source: The documentation for the build command provides more information on those requirements.
trans-unit.target: The documentation for the build command provides more information on those requirements.

trans-unit.source: Output files are written to the child `bin` folder, which will be created if it doesn't exist.
trans-unit.target: Output files are written to the child `bin` folder, which will be created if it doesn't exist.

trans-unit.source: Files will be overwritten as needed.
trans-unit.target: Files will be overwritten as needed.

trans-unit.source: Temporary files are written to the child `obj` folder.
trans-unit.target: Temporary files are written to the child `obj` folder.

trans-unit.source: In case of a project with multiple specified frameworks, `dotnet run` will first select the .NET Core frameworks.
trans-unit.target: In case of a project with multiple specified frameworks, `dotnet run` will first select the .NET Core frameworks.

trans-unit.source: If those do not exist, it will error out.
trans-unit.target: If those do not exist, it will error out.

trans-unit.source: To specify other frameworks, use the `--framework` argument.
trans-unit.target: To specify other frameworks, use the `--framework` argument.

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet run` command must be used in the context of projects, not built assemblies.
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet run` command must be used in the context of projects, not built assemblies.

trans-unit.source: If you're trying to execute a DLL instead, you should use [`dotnet`](dotnet.md) without any command like in the following example:
trans-unit.target: If you're trying to execute a DLL instead, you should use [`dotnet`](dotnet.md) without any command like in the following example:

trans-unit.source: For more information about the `dotnet` driver, see the [.NET Core Command Line Tools (CLI)](index.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the `dotnet` driver, see the [.NET Core Command Line Tools (CLI)](index.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: OPTIONS
trans-unit.target: OPTIONS

trans-unit.source: Delimits arguments to `dotnet run` from arguments for the application being run.
trans-unit.target: Delimits arguments to `dotnet run` from arguments for the application being run.

trans-unit.source: All arguments after this one will be passed to the application being run.
trans-unit.target: All arguments after this one will be passed to the application being run.

trans-unit.source: , `--framework` [FID]
trans-unit.target: , `--framework` [FID]

trans-unit.source: Runs the application for a given framework identifier (FID).
trans-unit.target: Runs the application for a given framework identifier (FID).

trans-unit.source: Configuration to use when publishing.
trans-unit.target: Configuration to use when publishing.

trans-unit.source: The default value is "Debug".
trans-unit.target: The default value is "Debug".

trans-unit.source: Specifies which project to run.
trans-unit.target: Specifies which project to run.

trans-unit.source: It can be a path to a project.json file or to a directory containing a project.json file.
trans-unit.target: It can be a path to a project.json file or to a directory containing a project.json file.

trans-unit.source: It defaults to current directory if not specified.
trans-unit.target: It defaults to current directory if not specified.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLES
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLES

trans-unit.source: Runs the project in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: Runs the project in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: Runs the project specified.
trans-unit.target: Runs the project specified.

trans-unit.source: Runs the project in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: Runs the project in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: The `--help` argument above is passed to the application being run, since the `--` argument was used.
trans-unit.target: The `--help` argument above is passed to the application being run, since the `--` argument was used.
